sub_topic: Show that every group of order pq, where p and q are distinct primes, is either cyclic or isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of orders p and q.
message_1: A group has an order of 35 which is not cyclic. Determine the possible values of p and q, where p and q are distinct primes, such that this group is isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of orders p and q.
message_2:
Since the order of the group is 35 and it is not cyclic, it must be the product of two distinct prime numbers. The prime factorization of 35 is 5 * 7. Therefore, the possible values for p and q are 5 and 7.

The group is isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of orders 5 and 7, which can be represented as C_5 Ã— C_7.
